template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a {business_type} that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a SaaS startup that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Create an automated SaaS support workflow that triages tickets, resolves simple issues automatically, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance metrics.
message.reasoning_content:
First, the user asks for a single-sentence plain-English prompt. That means I need to create one sentence that describes the workflow.

The workflow involves: triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking. All for a SaaS startup's customer support automation.

The prompt should be under 40 words. I need to count the words to ensure it's within the limit.

I should output only the prompt text, nothing else.

Now, let's craft the sentence. It needs to be concise and cover all elements: triage, auto-resolution, escalation, and performance tracking.

Possible prompt: "Create a customer support workflow that triages tickets, automatically resolves simple issues, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance metrics."

Let's count the words: Create (1), a (2), customer (3), support (4), workflow (5), that (6), triages (7), tickets (8), automatically (9), resolves (10), simple (11), issues (12), escalates (13), complex (14), cases (15), and (16), tracks (17), performance (18), metrics (19). So, 19 words. Under 40, so that's fine.

But is this accurate? It covers all the points. However, I should specify it's for a SaaS startup. The user said "for a SaaS startup," so I might include that.

Revised prompt: "Design a SaaS customer support automation workflow that triages issues, auto-resolves simple ones, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance."

Word count: Design (1), a (2), SaaS (3), customer (4), support (5), automation (6), workflow (7), that (8), triages (9), issues (10), auto-resolves (11), simple (12), ones (13), escalates (14), complex (15), cases (16), and (17), tracks (18), performance (19). Still 19 words.

I used "auto-resolves" instead of "automatically resolves" to save words. Also, "ones" refers to issues, so it's clear.

To make it more natural, I could say: "Create an automated support workflow for a SaaS startup that triages tickets, resolves simple issues automatically, escalates complex cases, and monitors performance."

Word count: Create (1), an (2), automated (3), support (4), workflow (5), for (6), a (7), SaaS (8), startup (9), that (10), triages (11), tickets (12), resolves (13), simple (14), issues (15), automatically (16), escalates (17), complex (18), cases (19), and (20), monitors (21), performance (22). 22 words, still under 40.

This seems good. I'll go with this version.

Finally, ensure it's a single sentence and plain-English. Yes, it is.

Output only the prompt text, so I'll just write the sentence.
